title: Making a wira (A)
creator_contributor_role: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, production company
Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies, production company
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Aboriginal Australia/Aboriginal Australians - Social life and customs
description: Episode number 14 of Series "People of the Australian western desert (A)". Djunjurai locates a suitable tree from which to make a small wooden digging dish or wira. He starts on the tree trunk by using the hand chopper he had made, but after a time changes to a metal axe. The raw material for the dish is brought back to camp where he shapes it with an adze.
related_objects: Series; S00570; People of the Australian western desert (A); Active; 1970
